subject: Photography
title: Hard Light: Sharp Edges
description: A fast breakdown of Hard Light: Sharp Edges for builders.

hook.text: A bare bulb casts razor-sharp shadows. Hard light is dramatic, contrasty, and unforgiving.

buildup.text: Hard light comes from small, intense sources â€” direct sun, bare flash, spotlights. Shadows have crisp, defined edges.

discovery.text: Hard light reveals every texture, wrinkle, and imperfection. It hides nothing and flatters few.

twist.text: Fashion photographers love hard light for its graphic quality. It creates bold, high-contrast images with punch.

climax.text: Hard light is a tool, not a problem. Knowing when to use it separates amateurs from artists.

punchline.text: Hard light doesn't whisper. It shouts.

quiz.question: What kind of source produces hard light?
options: Small, intense sources like bare bulbs or direct sun
Large, diffused sources like cloudy skies
